Articles.Content: Anyone else hoping to be able to create things like fuel ducts, power lines, as well as flattening spots for landing rockets and spaceplanes safely? Having remove bases have a quasi-city management feel would be very cool

10 minutes ago, Jack Mcslay said:

as well as flattening spots for landing rockets and spaceplanes safely

Terraforming will not be present in the game. Instead elevated pads will be built

17 minutes ago, mcwaffles2003 said:

Terraforming will not be present in the game. Instead elevated pads will be built

That's not terraforming, it's landscaping. Terraforming is when you transform an uninhabitable planet into an inhabitable one. That they have explicitly ruled out.

If they've said something equally categorical about landscaping I don't know.

Well they did say that working your way around the terrain is one of the challenges in base building.

Not working the terrain out of your way.

2 hours ago, The Aziz said:

Well they did say that working your way around the terrain is one of the challenges in base building.

Not working the terrain out of your way.

Truth told most likely you're right and there won't be landscaping either. From where I'm standing it's squarely in the "nice to have" category, and it might be tricky depending on how they're implementing surfaces. And even if it's technically feasible it would need a whole set of technologies, UIs, and other features that would be pretty labour-intensive to implement. So most likely it's a no-go and we'll just get platforms instead.

Even so, landscaping if properly implemented could be a very nice tool in the box for working your way around the terrain -- and AFAIK they haven't explicitly ruled it out, so we can always hope!

I think Terraforming is something a bit beyond the scope of the game's core experience. 

It sounds like something that would fit more with Spore or Surviving Mars or something like that because they're more about the grand colonization efforts and not about the nitty gritty of engineering or space navigation.
